title: Authors and Citation
text: Moritz Shore. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Shore M (2023). rswap: R interface SWAP model. R package version v0.1.0-prerelease.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rswap: An R interface for the SWAP model},   author = {Moritz Shore},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version v0.1.0-prerelease}, }

what: An R interface for the SWAP model
title: An R interface for the SWAP model
text: rswap R-package designed help interface work SWAP 4.2.0 [1]. consists variety functions assist user otherwise tedious repetitive tasks calibration proccess. scope package hopefully expanded overtime include sensitivity analysis, multi-core parallelization, autocalibration / PEST integration, scenario runs, much . DISCLAIMER: rswap much development, therefore robustly tested, extremely stable. use risk, critical results, now..

title: An R interface for the SWAP model
text: can install rswap GitHub: useful place start rswap_init() function. function creates “Hupselbrook” example case directory swap.exe. goes run setup, copy observed data template file, plot results. function finished succesfully, know rswap working properly. help specific function, use > ?functionname ⚠️IMPORTANT⚠️ important know rswap never modifies files project directory (project_path), instead files copied project_path project_path/rswap, modified , executed. results stored well, overwritten time. Remeber save results like keep , remeber anything project_path/rswap directory temporary!
code: # install remotes, if not already present install.packages("remotes")  remotes::install_github("moritzshore/rswap")  library(rswap) rswap_init(swapexe = "C:/path/to/swap.exe")

title: An R interface for the SWAP model
text: SWAP model can run using run_swap() function. needs know model setup located (project_path). swap.exe must located parent directory project_path! run_swap() can customized following parameters: - swap_file can set custom name SWAP main file (*.swp) - autoset_output can enabled, output SWAP model matches provided observed data (later) - timeout sets max allowed runtime SWAP ## access data? read output executed SWAP run, can use following command read_swap_output() returns two dataframes, daily_output contains depthwise values various variables. custom_depth contains custom variables custom depths either explictly altered user, automatically parsed autoset_output flag run_swap(). dataframe used widely throughout package. (/results added time) rswap heavily revolves around calibration, observed data high importance. running either build_rswap_directory() run_swap(), template observed file copied project_directory (already existing). user fill excel sheet appropriate data column names. Documentation found excel sheet. (switch .csv format soon) load observed file, can use following command: return dataframe user-entered observed data: …well vector detected variables find depths observed variables , can use following command: ..can also filtered specific variable passing variable
code: run_swap(project_path) modelled_data <- read_swap_output(project_path) > modelled_data$daily_output # A tibble: 17,520 x 5    DATE       DEPTH     H    WC  TEMP    <chr>      <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  1 2013-01-01  -0.5 -687. 0.118     0  2 2013-01-01  -1.5 -684. 0.118     0  3 2013-01-01  -2.5 -680. 0.118     0 # i 17,517 more rows # i Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows > modelled_data$custom_depth # A tibble: 730 x 14    DATE        RAIN  SNOW DRAINAGE    DSTOR  H_10  H_20  H_30 WC_15 WC_40 WC_70 TEMP_15 TEMP_40 TEMP_70    <date>     <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  1 2013-01-01   0       0        0 -0.0266  -648. -603. -550. 0.122 0.111 0.111       0       0       0  2 2013-01-02   0       0        0 -0.027   -624. -597. -564. 0.124 0.107 0.111       0       0       0  3 2013-01-03   0       0        0 -0.0305  -618. -595. -568. 0.124 0.104 0.111       0       0       0 # i 727 more rows # i Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows observed_data <- load_observed(project_path) > observed_data$data # A tibble: 168 x 11    DATE       WC_15 WC_40 WC_70  H_15  H_40  H_70 DRAINAGE TEMP_15 TEMP_40 TEMP_70    <date>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  1 2013-10-10  0.21  0.12  0.08  0.21  0.12  0.08     0.21    0.12    0.08    0.21  2 2013-10-11  0.21  0.12  0.08  0.21  0.12  0.08     0.21    0.12    0.08    0.21  3 2013-10-12  0.2   0.12  0.08  0.2   0.12  0.08     0.2     0.12    0.08    0.2  # i 158 more rows # i Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows > observed_data$observed_variables [1] "WC"       "H"        "DRAINAGE" "TEMP" get_depths(observed_data$data)

title: An R interface for the SWAP model
text: variety functions used visualize SWAP data, plot_over_under() plot_over_und() can passed variable, well vector depth.  (plot heavily relies code Neal Grantham) detailed look multiple variables , can use soft_calibration_plot() function can passed 3 variables, display interactively plot. observed data avaiable, displayed well.
code: plot_over_under(project_path, variable = "WC", depth = c(15, 40, 70)) > soft_calibration_plot(project_path, vars = c("H", "WC", "DRAINAGE"))

title: An R interface for the SWAP model
text: functions focus assesing model performance comparing modelling values user provided observed values. functionality based get_performance() function: function flexible, can passed number variables, depths, performance indicators stat (currently supported NSE, PBIAS, RSR, RMSE.
code: > get_performance(project_path, stat = "NSE", variable = "WC", depth = 15)  # A tibble: 1 × 2                                                                                              var     NSE   <chr> <dbl> 1 WC_15  0.62

title: An R interface for the SWAP model
text: calibrating model can useful keep track different model runs different parameterization. rswap aids proccess vareity functions, function saves entire model set directory (project_directory/rswap_saved). model run saved, can compared model runs, following functions.

title: An R interface for the SWAP model
text: saved least one run, can compare using  , function quite flexible, can passed available variable depth can compare performance various model runs using plot_statistics() function.  plot equally flexible, can passed variable amount depths supported stat. graph type can switched default, sorted ggplot
code: comparative_plot(project_path, variable = "WC", depth = 15) plot_statistics(project_path, var = "WC", depth = c(15,40,70))

what: Modification of Parameters and SWAP input files.
title: An R interface for the SWAP model
text: changing parameter rswap can done using parse_swap_file() function. returns dataframe parameters, well path saved tables located (working getting “list dataframes” work R, instead just writing tables #TODO!) can modify dataframe wish, whatever tools like, however rswap simple dedicated function . function takes dataframe parsed previous function, returns dataframe modified parameter. like run SWAP modified parameter set, first write new SWAP main file: run modified SWAP main file, course use run_swap() corresponding project_path swap_file parameters.
code: parsed <- parse_swp_file(project_path, swap_file) parameters <- change_swap_par(param = parsed$parameters, name = "COFRED", value = 0.55) write_swap_file(parameters = parameters, table_path = parsed$table_path, outpath = paste0(project_path, "/modified.swp"))

title: An R interface for the SWAP model
text: aformentioned functions rely basic general functions , designed internal use, can possibly also assitance end user. listed . NSE() # statistical performance calculation PBIAS() # statistical performance calculation RMSE() # statistical performance calculation RSR() # statistical performance calculation clean_swp_file() # returns swap main file sans comments filter_swap_data() # filters SWAP data (observed modelled) var depth get_swap_units() # returns unit SWAP variable. (WIP) match_mod_obs() # matches dataframe structure observed modelled melt_all_runs() # melts together saved runs + current tidy format

title: An R interface for the SWAP model
text: Linux Support Sensitivity Analysis Autocalibration / PEST support Parsing support swap files, just main file. Add documentation excel sheet (switch supporting .csv instead!) Add support multiple variables differing depths autoset_output Fix x-axis /plot, support missing values Give exported rswap functions consistent naming scheme (verb_swap_noun()) Move change_swap_parameter() io.R rw_parameters.R Add “filename” par write_swap_output() Wrapper function combine parse_swp_file() change_swap_par() (write_swap_file()?) Expand improve documentation plot_stat sorting follow stat property Improve r/w tables Add error message stat_plot / compare runs / melt runs encounters runs differing output formats

title: An R interface for the SWAP model

what:
Comparative Plot
this graph shows the current model run compared to the previous saved
runs. It highlights the differences between changed parameters etc. — comparative_plot

title: Initialize rswap — rswap_init
